sn22.52:1.2: “Mendicants, rationally apply the mind to form. Truly see the impermanence of form.
sn22.52:1.3: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with form.
sn22.52:1.4: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.52:1.5: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.
sn22.52:1.6: Rationally apply the mind to feeling …
sn22.52:1.15: consciousness. Truly see the impermanence of consciousness.
sn22.52:1.16: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with consciousness.
sn22.52:1.17: When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
sn22.52:1.18: When relishing and greed end, the mind is freed, and is said to be well freed.”
